info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong cold front will continue to impact portions North Central and Central Montana through at least 430 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cold front along a line extending from 25 miles north of Gildford to 12 miles north of Fort Benton to 6 miles northwest of Great Falls to 10 miles northeast of Augusta to 13 miles west of Heart Butte. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Scattered thunderstorms have also developed along and behind this front, while gusty northerly winds behind the front have brought wildfire smoke in from Canada. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, brief heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Smoke behind the cold front may reduce visibility to one mile or less. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Fort Benton, Chester, Cascade, Big Sandy, Fairfield, Belt, Dutton, Geraldine, Joplin, Highwood, East Glacier Park Village, Inverness, Black Eagle, East Glacier Park, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, The Knees and Heart Butte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
